questions.question_text:
An administrator wants to create a namespace for VMware vSphere with Tanzu.
Which two options can be defined as part of the namespace? (Choose two.)
What is the minimum required amount of RAM (in GB) in a VMware ESXi host when deploying a VMware Cloud Foundation Management Domain?

discussion.content: B 256gb. Course material 4.3 that this exam is based on details this 256gb

Selected Answer: B
VMware course materiol for VCF 4.X mentions:
Management Domain Minimum Hardware Requirements (2)
Component Requirements
Memory per server 256 GB

512 is total 4 nodes..
esxi single 128 gb
N+1 384 available
Answer is D = 128 GB

questions.question_text:
An administrator has created a separate workload domain for a virtual desktop environment and has deployed an NSX Edge cluster to support networking for the virtual desktops.
Which software component is deployed by VMware Cloud Foundation within the workload domain?

discussion.content: "Which software component is deployed by VMware Cloud Foundation within the workload domain?" <-- A .. NSX is a trick
NSX-T managers always hosted in management cluster. Edge nodes will deploy locally in WLD cluster. Hence right answer is "D"

questions.question_text:
In a customer's VMware Cloud Foundation environment, all workload domains share the same NSX-T Manager.
Which consideration should be taken when performing NSX-T upgrades?

choices.C: No operations can be performed on the NSX-T workload domains while NSX-T is being upgraded.
choices.B: The NSX-T Manager cluster is upgraded after the host clusters in the workload domain.
choices.D: Host clusters in an NSX-T workload domain must be upgraded while the NSX-T Manager is being upgraded.
choices.A: New features introduced in the upgrade are configurable while the NSX-T Manager cluster is being upgraded.

discussion.content:
B es Correct https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Cloud-Foundation/4.4/vcf-lifecycle/GUID-2D0DF7AF-4FE6-4A8C-AC2E-275E7F23FEBA.html <-- "Note:
The NSX Manager cluster is upgraded only if the Upgrade all host clusters setting is enabled on the Host Clusters tab. NSX Manager is upgraded after all host clusters in the workload domain are upgraded. New features introduced in the upgrade are not configurable until the NSX Manager cluster is upgraded."

questions.question_text: What are the minimum hardware requirements to host VMware Cloud Foundation infrastructure components within the management cluster?

choices.C: 3 vSAN Ready Nodes with two 10 GbE NICs and optionally one 1 GbE BMC NIC
choices.D: 3 vSAN Ready Nodes with two 25 GbE NICs
choices.A: 4 vSAN Ready Nodes with two 1 GbE NICs
choices.B: 4 vSAN Ready Nodes with two 10 GbE NICs and optionally one 1 GbE BMC NIC

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
4 hosts needed for mgmt, VI can have 3. B

Selected Answer: B
Answer is B
https://core.vmware.com/resource/planning-hardware-requirements-vmware-cloud-foundation-management-domain
4 v san ready nodes minimum requirement for management cluster.
